title: Calories in a Slice of Cheesecake
meta_description: Discover calories in a slice of cheesecake, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for better choices.
h1: Calories in a Slice of Cheesecake
assumptions: Standard New York-style cheesecake slice (1/8 of 9-inch cake, ~100g), with graham cracker crust, full-fat cream cheese, baked.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, portion size, toppings, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of cheesecake contains about 350 kcal and 24 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of cheesecake?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a standard slice.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in cheesecake per slice?
faqs.a: Roughly 24 g total fat, including 14 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does cheesecake have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, around 20 g sugars per slice from cream cheese and crust.
Low-fat or no-bake versions can reduce calories to 200-250 kcal per slice.

faqs.q: How does portion size affect calories in cheesecake?
faqs.a: A smaller slice (1/12 cake) is ~250 kcal; larger (1/6) ~500 kcal.
